</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Change-date-Column-DataType">Change <code>date</code> Column DataType<a class="anchor-link" href="#Change-date-Column-DataType">¶</a></h3><p>We will change <code>date</code> to <strong>datetime</strong> datatype.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Convert data column to datetime datatype</span>
<span class="n">covid</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'date'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_datetime</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">covid</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'date'</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="c1"># Display the datatype for date column</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">covid</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'date'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dtype</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>datetime64[ns]
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Isolating-the-Data-we-Need">Isolating the Data we Need<a class="anchor-link" href="#Isolating-the-Data-we-Need">¶</a></h3><p>We will now refine our dataset by filtering it to retain only records representing entire countries. Upon initial inspection, the <strong>province_state</strong> column revealed a mix of country and individual state data, potentially leading to analytical bias. As an example, the United States includes both national and state-level data points. To maintain data integrity, we will filter the dataset to country-level entries and assign the result to the <strong>covid_all_states</strong> variable.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># All states data</span>
<span class="n">covid_all_states</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">covid</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">covid</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'province_state'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'All States'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">drop</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">shape</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">covid_all_states</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span>

<span class="c1"># Display the dimensions</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"New number of rows is </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">."</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"The number of columns is maintained, we still have </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> columns."</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sep</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>New number of rows is 3781.
The number of columns is maintained, we still have 14 columns.
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Following the country-level filtering, the dataset now contains <strong>3,781</strong> records, down from the original <strong>10,903</strong>. To effectively analyze trends in both cumulative and daily data, we will partition the dataset into two distinct DataFrames: <strong>covid_all_states_cumulative</strong> for cumulative measures and <strong>covid_all_states_daily</strong> for daily measures.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Columns related to cummulative measures</span>
<span class="n">covid_all_states_cummulative</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">covid_all_states</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s1">'date'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'continent_name'</span><span class="p">,</span> \
                                                 <span class="s1">'two_letter_country_code'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'positive'</span><span class="p">,</span>\
                                                 <span class="s1">'hospitalized'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'recovered'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'death'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'total_tested'</span><span class="p">]]</span>

<span class="c1"># Columns related to daily measures</span>
<span class="n">covid_all_states_daily</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">covid_all_states</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s1">'date'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'country_region'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'active'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'hospitalized_curr'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'daily_tested'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'daily_positive'</span><span class="p">]]</span>

<span class="c1"># View the dimensions of the the datasets to confirm if filtering has been successful</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">covid_all_states_cummulative</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">covid_all_states_daily</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sep</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>(3781, 8)
(3781, 6)
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>With the dataset filtered to include relevant data points, we can now begin addressing our research questions.</p>
<h2 id="Identifying-Countries-with-the-Highest-Number-of-Deaths">Identifying Countries with the Highest Number of Deaths<a class="anchor-link" href="#Identifying-Countries-with-the-Highest-Number-of-Deaths">¶</a></h2><p>To identify the countries with the highest cumulative death counts, we will group the <strong>covid_all_states_cumulative</strong> DataFrame by <strong>two_letter_country_code</strong> and determine the maximum cumulative deaths for each country. We will then display the top ten countries with the highest death counts in both a table and a horizontal bar chart.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># A pivot table for cummulative deaths by country</span>
<span class="n">covid_deaths_cum</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">covid_all_states_cummulative</span><span class="o">.</span>\
<span class="n">pivot_table</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">values</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'death'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'two_letter_country_code'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">aggfunc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'max'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_values</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">by</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'death'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ascending</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">covid_deaths_cum</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'United States'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Italy'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'United Kingdom'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Belgium'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Russua'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Turkey'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Sweden'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Canada'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'New Zealand'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Poland'</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">covid_deaths_cum</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Cummulative Deaths'</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">covid_deaths_cum</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>                Cummulative Deaths
United States                98536
Italy                        33415
United Kingdom               33186
Belgium                       8903
Russua                        4693
Turkey                        4540
Sweden                        4395
Canada                        3682
New Zealand                   1421
Poland                        1065
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>As evident from the table, the <strong>United States of America</strong> records the highest number of cumulative deaths, with <strong>Italy</strong> in second place. We will proceed to visualize this data.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [12]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">barplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">covid_deaths_cum</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">orient</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'h'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Cummulative Deaths'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">covid_deaths_cum</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">hue</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Cummulative Deaths'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">despine</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">left</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">bottom</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xticks</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">40000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">80000</span> <span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'0'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'40,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'80,000'</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tick_params</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">labelcolor</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'gray'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tick_params</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">labeltop</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">labelbottom</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">25000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">2.6</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Top Ten Countries with Higher Cummulative Covid-19 Deaths'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontdict</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'weight'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'bold'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'family'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">})</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">25000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'United States is the Country that recorded highest Cummulative Deaths'</span><span class="p">,</span>\
         <span class="n">fontdict</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'weight'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'bold'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'family'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'color'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'gray'</span><span class="p">})</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can use the table and chart to answer our first question: <strong>Which countries have had the highest number of deaths due to Covid-19</strong>?</p>
<p><em><strong>Answer</strong></em>:</p>
<ol>
<li><p><strong>United States of America</strong>: Cummulative Deaths of <strong>98,536</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li><p><strong>Italy</strong>: Cummulative Deaths of <strong>33,425</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li><p><strong>United Kingdom</strong>: Cummulative Deaths of <strong>33,186</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<h2 id="Extracting-the-Top-Ten-Tested-Cases-Countries">Extracting the Top Ten Tested Cases Countries<a class="anchor-link" href="#Extracting-the-Top-Ten-Tested-Cases-Countries">¶</a></h2><p>We aim to determine the countries with the highest volume of tested and confirmed COVID-19 cases. To achieve this, we will analyze columns related to <strong>active</strong>, <strong>hospitalized</strong>, <strong>daily positive</strong>, and <strong>daily tested</strong> cases within the <strong>covid_all_states_daily</strong> DataFrame. The results will be presented in a table, followed by visualizations highlighting significant insights.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [13]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Determine the top ten tested cases</span>
<span class="n">covid_all_states_daily_sum</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">covid_all_states_daily</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'country_region'</span><span class="p">)[[</span><span class="s1">'active'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'hospitalized_curr'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'daily_tested'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'daily_positive'</span><span class="p">]]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">covid_all_states_daily_sum</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'daily_tested'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'tested'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'daily_positive'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'positive'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'hospitalized_curr'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'hospitalized'</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">covid_all_states_daily_sum_sorted</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">covid_all_states_daily_sum</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_values</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">by</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'tested'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ascending</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">covid_top_ten</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">covid_all_states_daily_sum_sorted</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">covid_top_ten</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>                 active  hospitalized    tested  positive
country_region                                           
United States         0             0  17282363   1877179
Russia          6924890             0  10542266    406368
Italy           6202214       1699003   4091291    251710
India                 0             0   3692851     60959
Turkey          2980960             0   2031192    163941
Canada            56454             0   1654779     90873
United Kingdom        0             0   1473672    166909
Australia        134586          6655   1252900      7200
Peru                  0             0    976790     59497
Poland           538203             0    928256     23987
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The table indicates that the <strong>United States of America</strong> and <strong>Russia</strong> have conducted the highest number of COVID-19 tests. We will use this data for further analysis, specifically to address the relationship between positive cases and the number of tests. For now, let's visualize the top ten countries with the most COVID-19 tests.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [14]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Visualization</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">barplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">covid_top_ten</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">orient</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'h'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'tested'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">covid_top_ten</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">hue</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'tested'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">despine</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">left</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">bottom</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ticklabel_format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'x'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">style</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'plain'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xticks</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">2500000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">7500000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">12500000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">17500000</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'2,500,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'7,500,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'12,500,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'17,500,000'</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">4000000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">2.6</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Top Ten Countries with Higher Volumes of Covid-19 Tests'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontdict</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'weight'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'bold'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'family'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">})</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">4000000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'The United States conducted more Covid-19 tests than any other country'</span><span class="p">,</span>\
         <span class="n">fontdict</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'weight'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'bold'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'family'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'color'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'gray'</span><span class="p">})</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tick_params</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">labeltop</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">labelbottom</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tick_params</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">labelcolor</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'gray'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Identifying-the-Highest-Positive-Against-Tested-Cases">Identifying the Highest Positive Against Tested Cases<a class="anchor-link" href="#Identifying-the-Highest-Positive-Against-Tested-Cases">¶</a></h2><p>In this section, we will calculate the COVID-19 <strong>positivity rate</strong>, defined as the proportion of positive test results to the total number of tests performed. Utilizing the table from the preceding analysis, which identified the ten countries with the highest testing volumes, we will determine the countries with the highest positivity rates. The formula for calculating the positivity rate is as follows:</p>
$$
Positivity Rate = \left(\frac{Positive Cases}{Total Number of People Tested}\right)*100
$$<p>A <strong>positivity_rate</strong> column will be appended to the <strong>covid_top_ten</strong> DataFrame, and the modified DataFrame will be assigned to the variable <strong>positivity_rated</strong>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [15]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">positivity_rated</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">covid_top_ten</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">copy</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">positivity_rated</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'positivity_rate'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">positivity_rated</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'positive'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">positivity_rated</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'tested'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span>
<span class="n">top_ten_positivity_rated</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">positivity_rated</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_values</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">by</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'positivity_rate'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ascending</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="s1">'positivity_rate'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">top_ten_positivity_rated</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>   country_region  positivity_rate
0  United Kingdom        11.326062
1   United States        10.861819
2          Turkey         8.071172
3           Italy         6.152337
4            Peru         6.091074
5          Canada         5.491549
6          Russia         3.854655
7          Poland         2.584093
8           India         1.650730
9       Australia         0.574667
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can now answer the second question: <strong>Which countries have had the highest number of positive cases against the number of tests</strong>?</p>
<p><em><strong>Answer</strong></em>:</p>
<ol>
<li><p><strong>United Kingdom</strong>: Positivity Rate of <strong>11%</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li><p><strong>United States</strong>: Positivity Rate of <strong>10.8%</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li><p><strong>Turkey</strong>: Positivity Rate of <strong>8%</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>Let us create a chart for our findings.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [16]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Visualization</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">barplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">top_ten_positivity_rated</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'positivity_rate'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'country_region'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">orient</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'h'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">hue</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'positivity_rate'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">despine</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">left</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">bottom</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">2.6</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Positivity Rate among Countries with Higher Volumes of Covid-19 Tests'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontdict</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'weight'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'bold'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'family'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">})</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'The United Kingdom recorded the highest positivity rate'</span><span class="p">,</span>\
         <span class="n">fontdict</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'weight'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'bold'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'family'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'color'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'gray'</span><span class="p">})</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xticks</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'0%'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'2%'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'4%'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'6%'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'8%'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'10%'</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tick_params</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">labelcolor</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'gray'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tick_params</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">labeltop</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">labelbottom</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">grid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Scaling-of-Data-to-Population-Level">Scaling of Data to Population Level<a class="anchor-link" href="#Scaling-of-Data-to-Population-Level">¶</a></h2><h3 id="Number-of-Tested-Cases-Against-Total-Population">Number of Tested Cases Against Total Population<a class="anchor-link" href="#Number-of-Tested-Cases-Against-Total-Population">¶</a></h3><p>In the first six months of the pandemic, testing volume was frequently cited as an indicator of a country's effective pandemic response. We will evaluate the correlation between testing volume and population size by examining the top ten countries with the highest test counts. Using population data for these countries during that timeframe, we will normalize their total COVID-19 test figures.</p>
<p>To proceed, we will add a population column to the <strong>covid_top_ten</strong> DataFrame. The population data for the top ten countries with the most COVID-19 tests is provided below:</p>
<ol>
<li><p><code>United States</code>: 331,002,651</p>
</li>
<li><p><code>Russia</code>: 145,934,462</p>
</li>
<li><p><code>Italy</code>: 60,461,826</p>
</li>
<li><p><code>India</code>: 1,380,004,385</p>
</li>
<li><p><code>Turkey</code>: 84,339,067</p>
</li>
<li><p><code>Canada</code>: 37,742,154</p>
</li>
<li><p><code>United Kingdom</code>: 67,886,011</p>
</li>
<li><p><code>Australia</code>: 25,499,884</p>
</li>
<li><p><code>Peru</code>: 32,971,854</p>
</li>
<li><p><code>Poland</code>: 37,846,611</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>These population figures will be utilized to construct a single DataFrame that incorporates the test counts and population data for each of the ten countries with the highest test volumes.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [17]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># population list</span>
<span class="n">pop_dict</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'population'</span><span class="p">:[</span><span class="mi">331002651</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">145934462</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">60461826</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1380004385</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">84339067</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">37742154</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">67886011</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">25499884</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">32971854</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">37846611</span><span class="p">]}</span>
<span class="n">pop</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pop_dict</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">pop</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'United States'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Russia'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Italy'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'India'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Turkey'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Canada'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'United Kingdom'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Australia'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Peru'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Poland'</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">covid_top_ten_pop</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">covid_top_ten</span>
<span class="n">covid_top_ten_pop</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">merge</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">left</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">covid_top_ten_pop</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">right</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pop</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">left_index</span><span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">right_index</span><span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">covid_top_ten_pop</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>                 active  hospitalized    tested  positive  population
United States         0             0  17282363   1877179   331002651
Russia          6924890             0  10542266    406368   145934462
Italy           6202214       1699003   4091291    251710    60461826
India                 0             0   3692851     60959  1380004385
Turkey          2980960             0   2031192    163941    84339067
Canada            56454             0   1654779     90873    37742154
United Kingdom        0             0   1473672    166909    67886011
Australia        134586          6655   1252900      7200    25499884
Peru                  0             0    976790     59497    32971854
Poland           538203             0    928256     23987    37846611
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Utilizing the data in the table, we will generate a column representing the proportion of each country's population that has been tested. This will be achieved by adding a column labeled <strong>percentage_tested</strong> and applying the following formula:</p>
$$
Population Scale = \left(\frac{Tested Population}{Total Population}\right)*100
$$<p>We will be calculating the percentage of the population that tested for covid-19 in the first six months of the pandemic.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [18]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">covid_top_ten_pop</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'percentage_tested'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">covid_top_ten_pop</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'tested'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">covid_top_ten_pop</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'population'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">covid_top_ten_pop</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s1">'tested'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'population'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'percentage_tested'</span><span class="p">]])</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>                  tested  population  percentage_tested
United States   17282363   331002651           5.221216
Russia          10542266   145934462           7.223973
Italy            4091291    60461826           6.766734
India            3692851  1380004385           0.267597
Turkey           2031192    84339067           2.408364
Canada           1654779    37742154           4.384432
United Kingdom   1473672    67886011           2.170804
Australia        1252900    25499884           4.913356
Peru              976790    32971854           2.962496
Poland            928256    37846611           2.452679
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>If we go by the above output, we can be able to answer the third question: <strong>Which countries have made the best effort in terms of the number of covid-19 tests conducted related to their population</strong>?</p>
<p><em><strong>Answer</strong></em>:</p>
<ol>
<li><p><strong>Russua</strong>- Percentage of the population tested: <strong>7%</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li><p><strong>Italy</strong>- Percentage pf the population tested: <strong>6.8%</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li><p><strong>United States</strong>- Percentage of the population tested: <strong>5%</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>Utilizing similar methods employed in the preceding analysis, we will determine the <strong>active</strong>, <strong>hospitalized</strong>, and <strong>positive</strong> COVID-19 case rates per capita for the countries with the most extensive testing. These calculations will provide insights for our project's concluding research question.</p>
<h3 id="Variables-as-Fractions-of-their-Population-Levels">Variables as Fractions of their Population Levels<a class="anchor-link" href="#Variables-as-Fractions-of-their-Population-Levels">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [19]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">covid_top_ten_pop</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[:,</span> <span class="p">:</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'active'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'active'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'population'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span>
<span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'hospitalized'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'hospitalized'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'population'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span>
<span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'tested'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'tested'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'population'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span>
<span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'positive'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'positive'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'population'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span>
<span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'active'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'active_cases'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'hospitalized'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'hospitalized_cases'</span><span class="p">,</span>\
                                           <span class="s1">'tested'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'tested_cases'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'positive'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'positive_cases'</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'population'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>                active_cases  hospitalized_cases  tested_cases  positive_cases
United States       0.000000            0.000000      5.221216        0.567119
Russia              4.745205            0.000000      7.223973        0.278459
Italy              10.258066            2.810042      6.766734        0.416312
India               0.000000            0.000000      0.267597        0.004417
Turkey              3.534495            0.000000      2.408364        0.194383
Canada              0.149578            0.000000      4.384432        0.240773
United Kingdom      0.000000            0.000000      2.170804        0.245867
Australia           0.527791            0.026098      4.913356        0.028235
Peru                0.000000            0.000000      2.962496        0.180448
Poland              1.422064            0.000000      2.452679        0.063380
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Despite presenting the data as percentages of total population, the wide range of values makes it difficult to assess the relative impact of COVID-19 across countries. To facilitate this assessment, we will rank each data point within its respective category, sum the ranks for each country, and create a <strong>total_ranks</strong> column. Sorting the table by <strong>total_ranks</strong> in descending order will allow us to identify the countries most significantly impacted by the pandemic.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [20]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage_ranked</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rank</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage_ranked</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'total_ranked'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage_ranked</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage_ranked</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span>\
    <span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'active_cases'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'active_rank'</span><span class="p">,</span>\
             <span class="s1">'hospitalized_cases'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'hosp_rank'</span><span class="p">,</span>\
             <span class="s1">'tested_case'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'tested_rank'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'positive_cases'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'pos_rank'</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage_ranked</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_values</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">by</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'total_ranked'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ascending</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">covid_top_ten_percentage_ranked</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>                active_rank  hosp_rank  tested_cases  pos_rank  total_ranked
Italy                  10.0       10.0           9.0       9.0          38.0
Russia                  9.0        4.5          10.0       8.0          31.5
United States           2.5        4.5           8.0      10.0          25.0
Australia               6.0        9.0           7.0       2.0          24.0
Canada                  5.0        4.5           6.0       6.0          21.5
Turkey                  8.0        4.5           3.0       5.0          20.5
Poland                  7.0        4.5           4.0       3.0          18.5
United Kingdom          2.5        4.5           2.0       7.0          16.0
Peru                    2.5        4.5           5.0       4.0          16.0
India                   2.5        4.5           1.0       1.0           9.0
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>This table contains answers for our last question: <strong>Which Countries were ultimately the most and the least affected related to their population</strong>?</p>
<p><strong>The most affected country in relation to its population</strong>:</p>
<ul>
<li>Italy</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>The least affected country in relation to its population</strong>:</p>
<ul>
<li>India</li>
</ul>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Findings">Findings<a class="anchor-link" href="#Findings">¶</a></h2><ol>
<li><p>During the initial six months of the pandemic, the <strong>United States of America</strong>, <strong>Italy</strong>, and the <strong>United Kingdom</strong> experienced the highest number of COVID-19 fatalities.</p>
</li>
<li><p>During the initial six months of the pandemic, the <strong>United Kingdom</strong>, the <strong>United States of America</strong>, and <strong>Turkey</strong> reported the highest ratios of positive COVID-19 cases to tests conducted.</p>
</li>
<li><p>During the initial six months of the pandemic, <strong>Russia</strong>, <strong>Italy</strong>, and the <strong>United States of America</strong> exhibited the highest rates of COVID-19 testing per capita.</p>
</li>
<li><p>During the initial six months of the pandemic, <strong>Italy</strong> experienced the greatest impact relative to its population, while <strong>India</strong> experienced the least.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<h2 id="Conclusion">Conclusion<a class="anchor-link" href="#Conclusion">¶</a></h2><p>This project analyzed COVID-19's impact and testing responses in various countries from January to July 2020, using a Kaggle dataset. After data cleaning and filtering, we identified the United States, Italy, and the United Kingdom as having the highest death tolls, while the United Kingdom, the United States, and Turkey reported the highest positivity rates. Russia, Italy, and the United States exhibited the most extensive testing per capita. By ranking and aggregating population-adjusted data, we concluded that Italy was the most affected country relative to its population, and India the least, highlighting the diverse pandemic impacts and responses during the crucial first six months.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>

    mathjaxscript[(window.opera ? "innerHTML" : "text")] =
        "MathJax.Hub.Config({" +

entry.title: Analysing Kickstarter Projects
entry.summary: This Project Demonstrates Proficiency in Data Cleaning, Exploratory Data Analysis and use of SQL.
entry.content:

  margin: 0px;

  position: relative;

}
div.cell:before {

  top: -1px;

}
.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;
  /* This padding is tuned to match the padding on the CodeMirror editor. */
  padding: 0.4em;
  margin: 0px;
  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Don't highlight prompt number selection */
  -webkit-touch-callout: none;
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;
  /* Use default cursor */
  cursor: default;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  .prompt {
    text-align: left;
  }
}
div.inner_cell {
  min-width: 0;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_area {
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  border-radius: 2px;
  background: #f7f7f7;
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there
   is no content in the output_subarea and the prompt. The main purpose of this is
   to make sure that empty JavaScript output_subareas have no height. */
div.prompt:empty {
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 0;
}
div.unrecognized_cell {
  padding: 5px 5px 5px 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell {
  border-radius: 2px;
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  background: #eaeaea;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.unrecognized_cell > div.prompt {
    display: none;
  }
}
div.code_cell {
  /* avoid page breaking on code cells when printing */
}
@media print {
  div.code_cell {
    page-break-inside: avoid;
  }
}
/* any special styling for code cells that are currently running goes here */
div.input {
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.input {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_prompt {
  color: #303F9F;
  border-top: 1px solid transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight {
  margin: 0.4em;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight > pre {
  margin: 0px;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
/* The following gets added to the <head> if it is detected that the user has a
 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See
 * notebookmain.js.  Such fonts will have keywords vertically offset with
 * respect to the rest of the text.  The user should select a better font.
 * See: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1503
 *
 * .CodeMirror span {
 *      vertical-align: bottom;
 * }
 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. This sets horizontal padding only,
    use .CodeMirror-lines for vertical */
  padding: 0 0.4em;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}
.CodeMirror-cursor {
  border-left: 1.4px solid black;
}
@media screen and (min-width: 2138px) and (max-width: 4319px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 2px solid black;
  }
}
@media screen and (min-width: 4320px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 4px solid black;
  }
}

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;

  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay {
  height: 100%;
  padding: 0px 0.4em;
  position: absolute;
  border-radius: 2px;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {

}
/* This class is the outer container of all output sections. */
div.output_area {
  padding: 0px;
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;

}

/* This is needed to protect the pre formating from global settings such

.output {

  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;

/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;

}

/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */

div.output_text {

  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */

}
