<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Analysing-Kickstarter-Projects">Analysing Kickstarter Projects<a class="anchor-link" href="#Analysing-Kickstarter-Projects">¶</a></h1><h2 id="1.0-Introduction">1.0 Introduction<a class="anchor-link" href="#1.0-Introduction">¶</a></h2><p>We are Data Analysts for a <strong>startup</strong> company that is considering to introduce their projects on kickstarter platform so that they could raise funding for their projects. <strong>Kickstarter</strong> is a global crowdfunding platform designed to help creators bring their projects to life. It primarily serves as a bridge between individuals or organizations with creative ideas and backers who provide the financial support needed to turn those ideas into reality. As Data Analysts we have been tasked to find the features of projects that are more likely to be successfull and those that do fail. Our findings will help the management team make informed decisions as to which projects to put on <strong>Kickstarter</strong> that will have high chances of recieving funding.</p>
<p>We are specifically going to answer the following questions with our analysis:</p>
<ol>
<li>What are the success rates across different categories?</li>
<li>Which countries have the highest success rates?</li>
<li>How does the funding goal affect success probability of the project?</li>
<li>What is the relationship between the number of backers and project's success?</li>
</ol>
<h3 id="1.1-Tools">1.1 Tools<a class="anchor-link" href="#1.1-Tools">¶</a></h3><ol>
<li>PostgreSQL</li>
<li>Python Libraries - [Pandas, psycopg2, SqlAlchemy, Numpy, Matplotlib and Seaborn]</li>
<li>Jupyter Notebooks</li>
</ol>
<p>The project is primarily designed to be completed using Structured Query Language (SQL). However, other ancillary tools, as indicated in the tools section, will be employed to make it an end-to-end and comprehensive project.</p>
<h3 id="1.2-Data">1.2 Data<a class="anchor-link" href="#1.2-Data">¶</a></h3><p>The dataset that will be used for the project was scraped from the official website of <strong>Kickstarter</strong> and was uploaded on <a href="https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/kemical/kickstarter-projects">kaggle.com</a>. The dataset has been downlaoded from kaggle in a Comma Separated Values (CSV) format and has been saved in our local drive. As already pointed out that this project's actual analysis will be done using SQL hence we will be required to create a PostgreSQL database in PostgreSQL Server and populate the database with datapoints from the CSV file. Everything will be demonstarted in the following sections.</p>
<h3 id="1.3-Import-Python-Libraries">1.3 Import Python Libraries<a class="anchor-link" href="#1.3-Import-Python-Libraries">¶</a></h3><p>We will import Python Libraries that will be used for loading data, cleaning data, manipulating data, making connections to the database, displaying data, and executing queries in our database and data visualisation.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Import pandas and numpy for Loading data, initial data cleaning, manipulating data and displaying data</span>
<span class="kn">import</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">pandas</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="k">as</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">pd</span>
<span class="kn">import</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">numpy</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="k">as</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">np</span>

<span class="c1"># Import psycopg2 for making connections to the database and executing queries in our database</span>
<span class="kn">import</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">psycopg2</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="k">as</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">psql</span>

<span class="c1"># Import pyplot from matplotlib and seaborn for data visualisation</span>
<span class="kn">import</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">matplotlib.pyplot</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="k">as</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">plt</span>
<span class="kn">import</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">seaborn</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="k">as</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">sns</span>

<span class="c1"># Configure the theme for visualisations</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_theme</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">style</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"white"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">palette</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"pastel"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="2.0-Loading-Data-and-Data-Cleaning">2.0 Loading Data and Data Cleaning<a class="anchor-link" href="#2.0-Loading-Data-and-Data-Cleaning">¶</a></h2><p>Here we will load our downloaded kickstarter CSV file and do some initial data cleaining before we introduce our data to the PostgreSQL server. We have a database in the PostgreSQL server that will be populated with the data from the CSV that we are about to load and clean in this section.</p>
<h3 id="2.1-Read-Kickstarter-Dataset">2.1 Read Kickstarter Dataset<a class="anchor-link" href="#2.1-Read-Kickstarter-Dataset">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># The dataset will assigned a variable name "ks_projects"</span>
<span class="n">ks_projects</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">r</span><span class="s2">"C:\Users\j\Documents\Data Analytics Projects\Kick_Starter\ks-projects-201801.csv"</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Display basic information from our dataset</span>
<span class="n">ks_projects</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">info</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre><class 'pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'>
RangeIndex: 378661 entries, 0 to 378660
Data columns (total 15 columns):
 #   Column            Non-Null Count   Dtype  
---  ------            --------------   -----  
 0   ID                378661 non-null  int64  
 1   name              378657 non-null  object 
 2   category          378661 non-null  object 
 3   main_category     378661 non-null  object 
 4   currency          378661 non-null  object 
 5   deadline          378661 non-null  object 
 6   goal              378661 non-null  float64
 7   launched          378661 non-null  object 
 8   pledged           378661 non-null  float64
 9   state             378661 non-null  object 
 10  backers           378661 non-null  int64  
 11  country           378661 non-null  object 
 12  usd pledged       374864 non-null  float64
 13  usd_pledged_real  378661 non-null  float64
 14  usd_goal_real     378661 non-null  float64
dtypes: float64(5), int64(2), object(8)
memory usage: 43.3+ MB
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From the above output, we can easily see that our dataset has <strong>378, 661</strong> rows and <strong>15</strong> columns. There is also a display of column's data types and the number of non-null variables.</p>
<h3 id="2.2-Check-for-Missing-values">2.2 Check for Missing values<a class="anchor-link" href="#2.2-Check-for-Missing-values">¶</a></h3><p>We will check for missing values and determine how well we can deal with them if they will happen to be present. How to deal with the missing values will basically depend on the nature of the missing values, our understanding of the dataset and how important to the analysis are the columns or rows with missing data.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Check for missing values</span>
<span class="n">ks_projects</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[3]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>ID                     0
name                   4
category               0
main_category          0
currency               0
deadline               0
goal                   0
launched               0
pledged                0
state                  0
backers                0
country                0
usd pledged         3797
usd_pledged_real       0
usd_goal_real          0
dtype: int64</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We have two columns with missing values: <code>name</code> has 4 missing values and <code>usd pledged</code> has <strong>3,797</strong> missing values. We will have to delete
the 4 records with missing names as we can not guess the names of unnamed projects. As for missing <code>usd pledged</code> we will leave them as they 
are because this is not a column of interest for this project and we can not risk droping <strong>3,797</strong> records for the sake of cleaning a column that will not be used in our analysis.</p>
<h3 id="2.3-Drop-Missing-Values">2.3 Drop Missing Values<a class="anchor-link" href="#2.3-Drop-Missing-Values">¶</a></h3><p>We will drop the <strong>4</strong> records with missing names.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Drop records with missing values in the name column</span>
<span class="n">ks_projects</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dropna</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">subset</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'name'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Display the shape of the DataFrame after droping the 4 records with missing names</span>
<span class="n">ks_projects</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[4]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>(378657, 15)</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We now have a reduced number of rows by the <strong>4</strong> records we deleted. Previously we had <strong>378, 661</strong> records and we are remaining with <strong>378, 657</strong> records.</p>
<h3 id="2.4-Check-for-Duplicates">2.4 Check for Duplicates<a class="anchor-link" href="#2.4-Check-for-Duplicates">¶</a></h3><p>Let us now check for duplicates in our dataset. It is typically not wise to work with duplicates as they can interfere with our analysis and distort the quality and validity of the outcomes (insights generated from the analysis).</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># check for duplicates</span>
<span class="n">ks_projects</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">duplicated</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[5]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>0</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From the output above we can see that our dataset does not have duplicates.</p>
<h3 id="2.5-Clean-Column-Names">2.5 Clean Column Names<a class="anchor-link" href="#2.5-Clean-Column-Names">¶</a></h3><p>We can  see that our column names have an inconsistent format. We have some columns that are presented in all capital letters e.g <code>ID</code>, some column names have an underscore for spacing e.g <code>main_category</code>, while some have a space for spacing e.g <code>usd pledged</code>. We have to standadise the format by making them small letters and spacing will be represented by an underscore.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Clean column names</span>
<span class="n">ks_projects</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ks_projects</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lower</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">' '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'_'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">regex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Display the cleaned column names</span>
<span class="n">ks_projects</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[6]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>Index(['id', 'name', 'category', 'main_category', 'currency', 'deadline',
       'goal', 'launched', 'pledged', 'state', 'backers', 'country',
       'usd_pledged', 'usd_pledged_real', 'usd_goal_real'],
      dtype='object')</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Our daset is now clean to be imported into the PostgreSQL database.</p>
<h2 id="3.0-Importing-Data-into-PostgreSQL-Database">3.0 Importing Data into PostgreSQL Database<a class="anchor-link" href="#3.0-Importing-Data-into-PostgreSQL-Database">¶</a></h2><p>We will now have to import our data into the database. We have a database named <strong>kickstarter</strong> created in our PostgreSQL server but it has no tables let alone data points within it. We will have to create a table within the database and define the data type for each column then we will import our cleaned csv dataset into it.</p>
<h3 id="3.1-Create-a-Connection-to-the-Database">3.1 Create a Connection to the Database<a class="anchor-link" href="#3.1-Create-a-Connection-to-the-Database">¶</a></h3><p>Let us create a connection to the PostgreSQL server and <strong>kickstarter</strong> database. This connection will enable us to perform various activities in the database from this Notebook.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Define the connection parameters</span>
<span class="n">df_params</span> <span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">"dbname=kickstarter user=postgres port=5432 host=localhost password=022027"</span>

<span class="c1"># Create a connection using psycopg2</span>
<span class="n">conn</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">psql</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">connect</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df_params</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Create a cursor for executing sql commands</span>
<span class="n">cursor</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">conn</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">cursor</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="3.2-Create-a-Table-in-Kickstarter-Database">3.2 Create a Table in Kickstarter Database<a class="anchor-link" href="#3.2-Create-a-Table-in-Kickstarter-Database">¶</a></h3><p>Now that we have successfully created a connection to the database, let us create a table in <strong>kickstarter</strong> database that we will eventually populate with data from our cleaned CSV file (ks_projects). The table that we will create will be called <strong>ks_projects</strong>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># A query that will be used for creating a table</span>
<span class="n">query</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"""</span>
<span class="s2">           CREATE TABLE public.ks_projects(</span>
<span class="s2">                         id integer PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL,</span>
<span class="s2">                         name varchar(250) NOT NULL,</span>
<span class="s2">                         category varchar(50) NOT NULL,</span>
<span class="s2">                         main_category varchar(50) NOT NULL,</span>
<span class="s2">                         currency varchar(10) NOT NULL,</span>
<span class="s2">                         deadline varchar(50) NOT NULL,</span>
<span class="s2">                         goal numeric NOT NULL,</span>
<span class="s2">                         launched varchar(50) NOT NULL,</span>
<span class="s2">                         pledged numeric NOT NULL,</span>
<span class="s2">                         state varchar(15) NOT NULL,</span>
<span class="s2">                         backers integer NOT NULL,</span>
<span class="s2">                         country varchar(15) NOT NULL,</span>
<span class="s2">                         usd_pledged numeric,</span>
<span class="s2">                         usd_pledged_real numeric NOT NULL,</span>
<span class="s2">                         usd_goal_real numeric NOT NULL);</span>
<span class="s2">        """</span>
<span class="c1"># Create a table</span>
<span class="n">cursor</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">execute</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">query</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We have successfully created a table <strong>ks_projects</strong> in <strong>kickstarter</strong> database. However, the table that we have created is empty. We have to populate it with data.</p>
<h3 id="3.3-Importing-Data-into-the-Table">3.3 Importing Data into the Table<a class="anchor-link" href="#3.3-Importing-Data-into-the-Table">¶</a></h3><p>We will have to format our data into a form that will be easy to import into the table using psycopg2. Psycopg2 works efficiently with data formated in 
a list of <strong>tuples</strong> or a list of <strong>lists</strong>, therefore we are going to convert our <strong>ks_projects</strong> DataFrame into a list of <strong>tuples</strong> first before we import the data into the database. <strong>Note</strong>: The data was was imported as a pandas <strong>DataFrame</strong>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Convert the Dataframe into a list of tuples</span>
<span class="n">ks_pg1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ks_projects</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_records</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">ks_pg</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">ks_pg1</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">ks_pg</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:])</span>

<span class="c1"># Check if we have successfuly converted our dataframe into a list of tuples</span>
<span class="n">ks_pg</span><span class="p">[:</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[9]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>[(1000002330,
  'The Songs of Adelaide & Abullah',
  'Poetry',
  'Publishing',
  'GBP',
  '2015-10-09',
  1000.0,
  '2015-08-11 12:12:28',
  0.0,
  'failed',
  0,
  'GB',
  0.0,
  0.0,
  1533.95)]</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The output above are attributes for a single record. This is an indication that we have succesfully converted our DataFrame into a list of tuples. 
Let us now import our list of tuples into the database table <strong>ks_projects</strong>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Importing data</span>
<span class="n">cursor</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">executemany</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"INSERT INTO ks_projects VALUES(</span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">, </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">, </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">, </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">, </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">, </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">, </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">, </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">, </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">, </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">, </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">, </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">, </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">, </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">, </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">)"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ks_pg</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The code above is for loading data from a list of <strong>tuples</strong> into a database table, in our case, the <strong>ks_projects</strong> table. Let us check if the data
has successfully been loaded into our database.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">cursor</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">execute</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"SELECT * FROM ks_projects"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">cursor</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fetchmany</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[11]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>[(1000002330,
  'The Songs of Adelaide & Abullah',
  'Poetry',
  'Publishing',
  'GBP',
  '2015-10-09',
  Decimal('1000.0'),
  '2015-08-11 12:12:28',
  Decimal('0.0'),
  'failed',
  0,
  'GB',
  Decimal('0.0'),
  Decimal('0.0'),
  Decimal('1533.95')),
 (1000003930,
  'Greeting From Earth: ZGAC Arts Capsule For ET',
  'Narrative Film',
  'Film & Video',
  'USD',
  '2017-11-01',
  Decimal('30000.0'),
  '2017-09-02 04:43:57',
  Decimal('2421.0'),
  'failed',
  15,
  'US',
  Decimal('100.0'),
  Decimal('2421.0'),
  Decimal('30000.0'))]</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We have been able to fetch 2 records from the staged database table, an indication that the table <strong>ks_projects</strong> has successfully been created. What we have done is that we have created a table in the database and loaded data into it
but we have not yet commited the changes that we have made to the server. This means that these changes are present in our notebook but the <strong>kickstarter</strong> database does not have a table of that name. We need to commit our changes once we are satisfied that the code we have written is a true representation of what we wanted to create.</p>
<p>Let us commit our changes.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [12]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">conn</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">commit</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="3.4-Closing-Connection">3.4 Closing Connection<a class="anchor-link" href="#3.4-Closing-Connection">¶</a></h3><p>Now that we have created a table and populated it with data in the <strong>kickstarter</strong> database, let us close the connection from the databse as we are done
using <strong>psycopg2</strong> for now. We will have to reconnect to the database again for reading data from the databse, however, will use another module other
than <strong>psycopg2</strong>.</p>
<p>Let us close our connection.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [13]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">conn</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">close</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="4.0-Understanding-the-Dataset">4.0 Understanding the Dataset<a class="anchor-link" href="#4.0-Understanding-the-Dataset">¶</a></h2><p>We have a table of data in our database, its now time we start using our data right from the database. We will begin by reconnecting to the database, this time with <strong>SqlAlchemy</strong>, not with <strong>psycopg2</strong> as we did before. Most of the activities that we can do with <strong>SqlAlchemy</strong> can also be accomplished by <strong>Psycopg2</strong>, however, we have decided to change the module because using <strong>Psycopg2</strong> produces a <strong>UserWarning</strong> error when paired with <strong>Pandas</strong>.</p>
<h3 id="4.1-Connect-to-database">4.1 Connect to database<a class="anchor-link" href="#4.1-Connect-to-database">¶</a></h3><p>We will start by importing <strong>create_engine</strong> module from SqlAlchemy Library, which will help us create a connection to the database and help us to run <strong>SQL</strong> queries directly from Jupyter Notebook. Then we will create a connection.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [14]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Import create_engine</span>
<span class="kn">from</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">sqlalchemy</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">create_engine</span>

<span class="c1"># Define a connection url</span>
<span class="n">db_url</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"postgresql://postgres:022027@localhost:5432/kickstarter"</span>

<span class="c1"># Create a connection to the database</span>
<span class="n">engine</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">create_engine</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">db_url</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="4.2-Display-Column-names-and-Datatypes">4.2 Display Column names and Datatypes<a class="anchor-link" href="#4.2-Display-Column-names-and-Datatypes">¶</a></h3><p>This will help us verify whether the data has been loaded as we expected and check if our connection was successfully made.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [15]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Display column names and their data types</span>
<span class="n">query</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"""</span>
<span class="s2">SELECT column_name, data_type</span>
<span class="s2">  FROM information_schema.columns</span>
<span class="s2"> WHERE table_name = 'ks_projects';</span>
<span class="s2">        """</span>
<span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_sql</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">query</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">engine</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[15]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped>
    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {
        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>column_name</th>
      <th>data_type</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>0</th>
      <td>id</td>
      <td>integer</td>
    </tr>

    </tr>

    </tr>
    <tr>

      <td>backers</td>

    </tr>
    <tr>

      <td>usd_pledged</td>
      <td>numeric</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>5</th>
      <td>usd_pledged_real</td>
      <td>numeric</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>6</th>
      <td>usd_goal_real</td>
      <td>numeric</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>7</th>
      <td>launched</td>
      <td>character varying</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>8</th>
      <td>country</td>
      <td>character varying</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>9</th>
      <td>name</td>
      <td>character varying</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>10</th>
      <td>category</td>

    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>11</th>
      <td>main_category</td>
      <td>character varying</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>12</th>

      <td>character varying</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>13</th>
      <td>deadline</td>
      <td>character varying</td>

    <tr>
      <th>14</th>
      <td>state</td>
      <td>character varying</td>

</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From the above output, we can see that there are <strong>15</strong> columns and data types we defined when we created a <strong>ks_projects</strong> table in the <strong>kickstarter</strong> database. The following is a list of the columns and their corresponding brief description.</p>
<ol>
<li><code>id</code>: Unique Identifier for each Project</li>
<li><code>name</code>: Name of the Project</li>
<li><code>category</code>: Sub-Category of Project</li>
<li><code>main_category</code>: Main category of the project</li>
<li><code>currency</code>: Currency used for the goal and pledged</li>
<li><code>deadline</code>: Date the campaign ends</li>
<li><code>goal</code>: Fundraising goal</li>
<li><code>launched</code>: Date the campain was launched</li>
<li><code>pledged</code>: Amount pledged</li>
<li><code>state</code>: State of Project (Successful, cancelled, etc)</li>
<li><code>backers</code>: Number of project's backers</li>
<li><code>country</code>: Country of the project</li>
<li><code>usd_pledged</code>: Pledged amount in USD (estimated)</li>
<li><code>usd_pledged_real</code>: Actual pledged amount in USD</li>
<li><code>usd_goal_real</code>: Actual funding goal in USD</li>
</ol>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="5.0-Exploratory-Data-Analysis-(EDA)">5.0 Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)<a class="anchor-link" href="#5.0-Exploratory-Data-Analysis-(EDA)">¶</a></h2><h5 id="Questions-to-Explore">Questions to Explore<a class="anchor-link" href="#Questions-to-Explore">¶</a></h5><ol>
<li>What are the success rates across different <code>main_categories</code>?</li>
<li>Which <code>countries</code> have the highest success rates?</li>
<li>How does the funding goal affect success probability?</li>
<li>What is the relationship between the number of backers and projects' success?</li>
</ol>
<h3 id="5.1-What-are-the-success-rates-across-different-main_categories?">5.1 What are the success rates across different <code>main_categories</code>?<a class="anchor-link" href="#5.1-What-are-the-success-rates-across-different-main_categories?">¶</a></h3><p>The following is a query that displays <strong>success rates</strong> accross different <code>main_categories</code> with a focus on the top ten categories by success rates.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [16]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">query</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"""</span>
<span class="s2">SELECT main_category,</span>
<span class="s2">       ROUND(SUM(CASE</span>
<span class="s2">                WHEN state = 'successful' THEN 1</span>
<span class="s2">                    ELSE 0</span>
<span class="s2">                 END) * 100.0 / COUNT(*), 2) AS success_rate</span>
<span class="s2">  FROM ks_projects</span>
<span class="s2"> GROUP BY main_category</span>
<span class="s2"> ORDER BY success_rate DESC</span>
<span class="s2"> LIMIT 10;</span>
<span class="s2">         """</span>
<span class="n">top_10_main_categories</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_sql</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">query</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">engine</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">top_10_main_categories</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[16]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped>
    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {
        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>main_category</th>
      <th>success_rate</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>0</th>
      <td>Dance</td>
      <td>62.05</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>1</th>
      <td>Theater</td>
      <td>59.87</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>2</th>
      <td>Comics</td>
      <td>54.00</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>3</th>
      <td>Music</td>
      <td>46.61</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>4</th>
      <td>Art</td>
      <td>40.89</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>5</th>
      <td>Film & Video</td>
      <td>37.15</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>6</th>
      <td>Games</td>
      <td>35.53</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>7</th>
      <td>Design</td>
      <td>35.09</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>8</th>
      <td>Publishing</td>
      <td>30.85</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>9</th>
      <td>Photography</td>
      <td>30.66</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From the output above, projects in the <strong>Dance</strong> main_category have a probability of <strong>62%</strong> of success while those in the <strong>Theater</strong> main_category come second with a success probability of around <strong>60%</strong>.</p>
<p>Let us plot the the top 5 <code>main_categories</code> by success_rates:</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [17]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">figure</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">figsize</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">barplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">top_10_main_categories</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">(),</span> <span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'main_category'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'success_rate'</span><span class="p">,</span>\
            <span class="n">orient</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'v'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">hue</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'success_rate'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">legend</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">width</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="p">,</span>\
            <span class="n">palette</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'light:grey'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Success Rate'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">72</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Main Categories with Highest Success Rates'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">weight</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'bold'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">14</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">0.9</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">66</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"Projects in the Dance category are more likely to </span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2"> receive funding"</span><span class="p">,</span>\
         <span class="n">weight</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'semibold'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'grey'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">yticks</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">60</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">50</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">40</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">30</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">20</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'60%'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'50%'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'40%'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'30%'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'20%'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'10%'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'0%'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">grid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">visible</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">which</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'major'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'y'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.3</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">despine</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">left</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">bottom</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From the bar chart, projects in the dance category are more likely to receive funding with a probability of around 0.62. Projects in <strong>Theater</strong> category are also more likely to be funded with a probability of around 0.6. One may still easily see the probability of the other three categories as illustrated above.</p>
<h3 id="5.2-Which-Countries-have-the-highest-Success-Rate?">5.2 Which Countries have the highest Success Rate?<a class="anchor-link" href="#5.2-Which-Countries-have-the-highest-Success-Rate?">¶</a></h3><p>This following is a query for displaying the <strong>Top Five</strong> Countries with the highest Success Rate:</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [18]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">query</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"""</span>
<span class="s2">SELECT country,</span>
<span class="s2">       ROUND(SUM(CASE</span>
<span class="s2">                    WHEN state = 'successful' THEN 1</span>
<span class="s2">                    ELSE 0</span>
<span class="s2">                 END) * 100.0 / COUNT(*), 2) AS success_rate</span>
<span class="s2">  FROM ks_projects</span>
<span class="s2"> GROUP BY country</span>
<span class="s2"> ORDER BY success_rate DESC</span>
<span class="s2"> LIMIT 5;</span>
<span class="s2">         """</span>
<span class="n">top_5_countries</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_sql</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">query</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">engine</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">top_5_countries</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[18]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>

        vertical-align: middle;
    }

        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>country</th>
      <th>success_rate</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>0</th>
      <td>US</td>
      <td>37.35</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>1</th>
      <td>GB</td>
      <td>35.84</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>2</th>
      <td>HK</td>
      <td>34.95</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>3</th>
      <td>DK</td>
      <td>32.35</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>4</th>
      <td>SG</td>
      <td>32.07</td>

</table>
