</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Observations:"><em>Observations:</em><a class="anchor-link" href="#Observations:">¶</a></h2><ul>
<li>The dataset has got 50,000 rows ranging from <strong>0</strong> to <strong>49999</strong>.</li>
<li>There are 20 columns, most of which are strings.</li>
<li>Some columns have got <strong>missing</strong> values</li>
<li>Some columns have got data types that are not normal. For instance,  The expectation is for <em>dateCrawled</em> column to have <strong>datetime</strong> data type.</li>
<li>The column names use <strong>camelCase</strong> instead of python's preferred <strong>snakecase</strong>.</li>
<li>Some columns have got <strong>Germany</strong> worded values; values that are presented in Germany language.</li>
</ul>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="3.-Data-Cleaning">3. Data Cleaning<a class="anchor-link" href="#3.-Data-Cleaning">¶</a></h2><h3 id="Cleaning-Column-Names">Cleaning Column Names<a class="anchor-link" href="#Cleaning-Column-Names">¶</a></h3><p>Let us convert the column names from <strong><em>camelCase</em></strong> to <strong><em>snakecase</em></strong> and change some of the column names so that they become more descriptive. We are also going to introduce an <strong>underscore</strong> into some column names to represent a space.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># camelCase to snakecase</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lower</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="c1"># renaming the some columns</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'yearofregistration'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'registration_year'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'monthofregistration'</span><span class="p">:</span>\
                       <span class="s1">'registration_month'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'notrepaireddamage'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'unrepaired_damage'</span><span class="p">,</span>\
                       <span class="s1">'datecreated'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'ad_created'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'nrofpictures'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'number_of_pictures'</span><span class="p">,</span>\
                      <span class="s1">'kilometer'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'odometer'</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Introducing an underscore in some columns</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'date_crawled'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'name'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'seller'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'offer_type'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'ab_test'</span><span class="p">,</span>
       <span class="s1">'vehicle_type'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'registration_year'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'gear_box'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'power_ps'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'model'</span><span class="p">,</span>
       <span class="s1">'odometer'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'registration_month'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'fuel_type'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'brand'</span><span class="p">,</span>
       <span class="s1">'unrepaired_damage'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'ad_created'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'number_of_pictures'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'postal_code'</span><span class="p">,</span>
       <span class="s1">'last_seen'</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="c1"># Displaying column names to check if they have been successfully cleaned</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[6]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>Index(['date_crawled', 'name', 'seller', 'offer_type', 'price', 'ab_test',
       'vehicle_type', 'registration_year', 'gear_box', 'power_ps', 'model',
       'odometer', 'registration_month', 'fuel_type', 'brand',
       'unrepaired_damage', 'ad_created', 'number_of_pictures', 'postal_code',
       'last_seen'],
      dtype='object')</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Checking-for-and-Removing-Duplicates">Checking for and Removing Duplicates<a class="anchor-link" href="#Checking-for-and-Removing-Duplicates">¶</a></h3><p>We are going to check for duplicate rows. If we have duplicate records we are going to remove them from our dataset.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Check for duplicate rows</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">duplicated</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[7]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>2</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We have <strong>2</strong> duplicate records as identified from the code above. We are going to remove them in the following exercise.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Remove duplicate rows</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop_duplicates</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ignore_index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Display the number of remaining rows and columns</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[8]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>(49998, 20)</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We are remaining with <strong>49,998</strong> records and <strong>20</strong> columns after dropping duplicate rows.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Converting-Data-Types">Converting Data Types<a class="anchor-link" href="#Converting-Data-Types">¶</a></h3><ul>
<li>We have columns with <strong>numeric</strong> data that has been stored as texts (<strong>strings</strong>).</li>
<li>There are columns with <strong>dates</strong> that are stored as texts.</li>
<li>We also have some columns where all or almost all values are the same. These can often be dropped as they do not have useful information.</li>
</ul>
<p>We can determine which columns to clean by exploring the data. We are about to make a quick exploration to determine which columns to clean further.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Checking data types</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dtypes</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[9]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>date_crawled           object
name                   object
seller                 object
offer_type             object
price                 float64
ab_test                object
vehicle_type           object
registration_year     float64
gear_box               object
power_ps              float64
model                  object
odometer               object
registration_month    float64
fuel_type              object
brand                  object
unrepaired_damage      object
ad_created             object
number_of_pictures    float64
postal_code           float64
last_seen              object
dtype: object</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><code>odometer</code> is an <strong>object</strong> while it is supposed to be an <strong>integer</strong>. Let us convert it to an integer data type.</p>
<p>But first, we will find out what made python to recognise <code>odometer</code>as an object in the first place. This usually happens when there is a <strong>text</strong> value in an array of integers or floats.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">odometer</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">value_counts</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[10]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>odometer
150000            32453
125000             5166
100000             2153
90000              1667
80000              1403
70000              1347
60000              1165
50000              1007
5000                955
40000               874
30000               835
20000               733
10000               239
30-03-16 00:44        1
Name: count, dtype: int64</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The above output indicates that this <code>odometer</code> has a <strong>typo</strong> in the form of a <strong>date</strong> stored as a string. The value "30-03-16 00:44" is not supposed to be in this column. We are going to remove this record from the dataframe and convert the <code>odometer</code> to integer data type.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># removing a typo from the "odometer" column</span>
<span class="n">auto</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'odometer'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">!=</span> <span class="s1">'30-03-16 00:44'</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="c1"># converting datatype to int64</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'odometer'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'odometer'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'int64'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># displaying the "odometer" data type</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'odometer'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dtype</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[11]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>dtype('int64')</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can see that <code>odometer</code>data type is now <strong>int64</strong> which is an integer.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><code>postal_code</code> is a float64 data type while it is supposed to be an object. Lets convert <code>postal_code</code>to an object.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [12]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># postal_code from float to an object</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'postal_code'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'postal_code'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'O'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># display 'postal_code' data type</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'postal_code'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dtype</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[12]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>dtype('O')</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><code>postal_code</code>has successfuly been converted to an object data type.</p>
<p>Lets  now convert <code>date_crawled</code>, <code>ad_created</code>and <code>last_seen</code>to  <strong>datetime</strong> data types.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [13]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># convert "date_crawled" to datetime.</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'date_crawled'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_datetime</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'date_crawled'</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="c1"># convert "ad_created" to datetime.</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ad_created'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_datetime</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ad_created'</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="c1"># convert "last_seen" to datetime</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'last_seen'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_datetime</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'last_seen'</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="c1"># display data type for "date_crawled", "ad_created" and "last_seen"</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s2">"date_crawled"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"ad_created"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"last_seen"</span><span class="p">]]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dtypes</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[13]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>date_crawled    datetime64[ns]
ad_created      datetime64[ns]
last_seen       datetime64[ns]
dtype: object</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can see that our date columns have successfully been converted to <strong>datetime64[ns]</strong></p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>It has also just come to our attention that odometer is lead in <strong>kilometers</strong>,  therefore we have to indicate that distance is measured in kilometers. We will convert <code>odometer</code> column name to <code>odometer_km</code>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [14]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># rename "odometer" to "odometer_km"</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'odometer'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'odometer_km'</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now that our dataset is <strong><em>Presumably</em></strong> clean, let us look at some <strong>descriptive statistics</strong>. These might as well uncover some areas that may need more cleaning or tell us which columns to remove from our dataset.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [15]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Descriptive statistics</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">describe</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">include</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'all'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[15]:</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Observation:"><em>Observation:</em><a class="anchor-link" href="#Observation:">¶</a></h3><ul>
<li>Column <code>seller</code> has one value "<em>privat</em>" with a frequency of <strong>49,997</strong> which is equal to total number of rows.</li>
<li>Column <code>offer_type</code>has one vale "<em>Angebot</em>" with a frequency of <strong>49, 997</strong>.</li>
<li>Columns <code>gear_box</code>, <code>fuel_type</code> and <code>unrepaired_damage</code> contain values that are in <strong>Germany</strong> words. These columns will require further exploration and, if need be, change Germany words to their corresponding English words.</li>
<li>Our dataset has got missing values. We are going to inspect the columns with missing values and come up with a better way for dealing with the missing values. That is whether to leave them as they are, replace them with other values, deleting rows with missing values or dropping columns with missing values.</li>
<li>Column <code>price</code> seems to have outliers. We will have to explore it further and deal will outliers accordingly.</li>
<li>Column <code>registration_year</code> has got strange values. We have a minimum value of <strong>1000</strong> and a maximum of <strong>9999</strong>, these are unrealistic values because in the year <strong>1000</strong> there were no cars yet and the year <strong>9999</strong> is in the future. We will explore this column further and make the necessary adjustments.</li>
<li>The dataset was <strong>crawled</strong> (pull from the website) in the year <strong>2016</strong> as indicated by the minimum <code>date_crawled</code> of <strong>2016-01-04</strong> and maximum <code>date_crawled</code> of <strong>2016-12-03</strong> this means we expect to have data for secondhand cars that were initially registered in the years before <strong>2016</strong>.</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="Dropping-Columns">Dropping Columns<a class="anchor-link" href="#Dropping-Columns">¶</a></h3><p>We are going to drop <code>seller</code>, <code>number_of_pictures</code> and <code>offer_type</code> because they have one <strong>unique</strong> value each, they are not necessary for our analysis.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [16]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Drop 'seller' and 'offer_type'</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'seller'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'offer_type'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'number_of_pictures'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[16]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>(49997, 17)</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>After dropping two columns we are remaing with <strong>17</strong> columns.</p>
<h3 id="Correcting-Missing-Values">Correcting Missing Values<a class="anchor-link" href="#Correcting-Missing-Values">¶</a></h3><p>We are going to find the number of missing values from every column and decide what to do with the missing values based on the nature of the values.</p>
<p>We will first find the number of <code>null</code> values in our dataset.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [17]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Displaying the total number of missing values in our dataset</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[17]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>date_crawled             0
name                     0
price                    0
ab_test                  0
vehicle_type          5088
registration_year        0
gear_box              2696
power_ps                 0
model                 2781
odometer_km              0
registration_month       0
fuel_type             4452
brand                    0
unrepaired_damage     9786
ad_created               0
postal_code              0
last_seen                0
dtype: int64</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From the look of things, we have <strong>5</strong> columns with missing values. All these columns are categorical in nature. We are going to replace all the missing values with <strong>"UnKnown"</strong>. The following are the columns with missing values:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>vehicle_type</code></li>
<li><code>gear_box</code></li>
<li><code>model</code></li>
<li><code>fuel_type</code></li>
<li><code>unrepaired_damage</code></li>
</ul>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [18]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Replace missing values with "UnKnown"</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fillna</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'UnKnown'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Checking our dataset if we still have missing values</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isna</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[18]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>date_crawled          0
name                  0
price                 0
ab_test               0
vehicle_type          0
registration_year     0
gear_box              0
power_ps              0
model                 0
odometer_km           0
registration_month    0
fuel_type             0
brand                 0
unrepaired_damage     0
ad_created            0
postal_code           0
last_seen             0
dtype: int64</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We now have a dataset without missing values as indicated in the above output.</p>
<h3 id="Cleaning-gear_box,-fuel_type-and-unrepaired_damage-columns">Cleaning <code>gear_box</code>, <code>fuel_type</code> and <code>unrepaired_damage</code> columns<a class="anchor-link" href="#Cleaning-gear_box,-fuel_type-and-unrepaired_damage-columns">¶</a></h3><p>These columns contain non English words. We will have to identify these words, find their English meaning and replace them with English words.</p>
<p>We will  start by exploring <code>gear_box</code> column.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [19]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Displaying unique values in "gear_box" column</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'gear_box'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[19]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>array(['manuell', 'automatik', 'UnKnown'], dtype=object)</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><code>gear_box</code> contains the following unique values <strong>manuell</strong>, <strong>automatik</strong> and <strong>Unknown</strong>. <strong>Manuell</strong> means <strong>Manual</strong> while <strong>automatik</strong> means <strong>Automatic</strong>. We are going replace the English words for Germany words.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [20]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Cleaning "gear_box" column</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'gear_box'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'gear_box'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span>\
<span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'manuell'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Manual'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">regex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'automatik'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Automatic'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">regex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Display "gear_box" unique values</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'gear_box'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[20]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>array(['Manual', 'Automatic', 'UnKnown'], dtype=object)</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><code>gear_box</code>has successfully been cleaned.</p>
<p>Let us explore <code>fuel_type</code> column.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [21]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Displaying "fuel_type" unique values</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'fuel_type'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[21]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>array(['benzin', 'diesel', 'UnKnown', 'lpg', 'cng', 'andere', 'hybrid',
       'elektro'], dtype=object)</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>In <code>fuel_type</code> column we are going to replace <strong>benzin</strong> with <strong><em><code>petrol</code></em></strong>, <strong>andere</strong> with <strong><em><code>others</code></em></strong> and <strong>elektro</strong> with <strong><em><code>electric</code></em></strong>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [22]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Cleaning "fuel_type" column</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'fuel_type'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'fuel_type'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'benzin'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'petrol'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">regex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>\
<span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'andere'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'others'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">regex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'elektro'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'electric'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">regex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>\
<span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'UnKnown'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'unknown'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">regex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Display "fuel_type" unique values</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'fuel_type'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[22]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>array(['petrol', 'diesel', 'unknown', 'lpg', 'cng', 'others', 'hybrid',
       'electric'], dtype=object)</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><code>fuel_type</code> has successfully been cleaned.</p>
<p>Its time we explore <code>unrepaired_damage</code>column.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [23]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Displaying "unrepaired_damage" unique values</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'unrepaired_damage'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[23]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>array(['nein', 'UnKnown', 'ja'], dtype=object)</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We have <strong>nein</strong> for <strong><em>No</em></strong> and <strong>ja</strong> for <strong>Yes</strong>. Lets us replace these values accordingly.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [24]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Cleaning "unrepaired_damage" column</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'unrepaired_damage'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'unrepaired_damage'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span>\
<span class="nb">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'nein'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'No'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">regex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'ja'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Yes'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">regex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Display "unrepaired_damage" unique values</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'unrepaired_damage'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[24]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>array(['No', 'UnKnown', 'Yes'], dtype=object)</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><code>unrepaired_damage</code> has successfully been cleaned.</p>
<p>Let us now clean <code>registration_year</code> column. This column has a value of <strong>1000</strong> as a minimum year of registration and <strong>9999</strong> as maximum year of registration. These values are unrealistic since in those years, cars were not have been invented and and it is in the future respectively. Let us explore the column, there might be other irregularities that could as well need our attention.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [25]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'registration_year'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[25]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>array([2007., 2001., 2011., 2000., 2013., 2005., 2002., 1996., 2004.,
       2018., 1993., 2008., 2006., 2012., 2014., 2003., 1997., 1995.,
       1994., 2010., 1998., 1999., 2016., 2009., 2017., 2015., 1971.,
       1987., 1992., 1990., 1985., 1978., 1967., 1989., 1986., 2019.,
       1980., 1982., 1991., 1951., 1968., 1983., 1950., 1988., 1973.,
       1956., 1969., 1960., 1979., 1976., 1984., 1957., 1961., 1910.,
       1965., 1977., 6000., 1972., 1962., 1000., 1974., 1958., 1970.,
       5555., 3200., 1300., 1975., 1966., 1981., 5911., 5000., 1955.,
       1964., 1939., 1933., 1963., 1953., 1400., 4800., 1600., 8455.,
       4100., 1943., 4000., 9000., 1954., 1947., 9999., 1959., 1920.,
       1936., 1952., 1800., 1929., 3000., 1932., 1111., 1938., 1946.])</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>It seems the column has got many unrealistic values that need to be cleaned. There are some values that represent years before  cars were invented and values that represent years from the future. Since the first car was made in <strong>1886</strong> we are going to filter our data to include years from <strong>1886</strong> to <strong>2016</strong> the year our data was <strong>crawled</strong> from the website.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [26]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Filtering our dataset to remove unrealistic years</span>
<span class="n">auto</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'registration_year'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">>=</span> <span class="mi">1886</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'registration_year'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o"><=</span> <span class="mi">2016</span><span class="p">)]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Verify if our has been cleaned</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'registration_year'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">describe</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[26]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>count    48055.000000
mean      2002.814608
std          7.397660
min       1910.000000
25%       1999.000000
50%       2003.000000
75%       2008.000000
max       2016.000000
Name: registration_year, dtype: float64</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We have successfully cleaned <code>registration_year</code> column. It now has a minimum year of <strong>1910</strong> and maximum year of <strong>2016</strong>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Dealing-with-Outliers">Dealing with Outliers<a class="anchor-link" href="#Dealing-with-Outliers">¶</a></h3><p>The probable candidates for outliers in our datasets are columns <code>price</code> and <code>odometer_km</code>. Let us explore these two columns for outlier and decide how best we can deal with them.</p>
<p>We will use a <strong>boxplot</strong> for this activity.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [27]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Plotting a boxplot</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">boxplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">vert</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">False</span> <span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Price BoxPlot'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontdict</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'fontfamily'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'weight'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'bold'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'size'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">})</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ticklabel_format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'x'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">style</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'plain'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Price (US dollars)'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xticks</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">20000000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">40000000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">60000000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">80000000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">100000000</span><span class="p">],</span>\
           <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'0'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'20,000,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'40,000,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'60,000,000'</span><span class="p">,</span>\
            <span class="s1">'80,000,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'100,000,000'</span><span class="p">],</span><span class="n">rotation</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">45</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.7</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">grid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">visible</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span> 
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From the <strong>BoxPlot</strong> we can see that <code>price</code> column has got outliers as some cars are indicated to be selling at a price of more than <strong>1, 000,000</strong> US dollars. There is even a car that is selling at a price of <strong>100, 000,000</strong> US dollars which is unrealistic. We also have cars which are priced at <strong>0.00</strong> which does not make sense. I do not think someone may place an <strong>ad</strong> for a car that does not have value.</p>
<p>Let us filter our dataset to include cars that are selling at a price of not more than <strong>100,000</strong> US dollars and exclude all cars with a price of less than <strong>500</strong> US dollars. We will plot the <strong>BoxPlot</strong> to display the changes.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [28]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Filter our dataset</span>
<span class="n">auto</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">>=</span> <span class="mi">500</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o"><=</span> <span class="mi">100000</span><span class="p">)]</span>

<span class="c1"># Plot a boxplot</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">boxplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">vert</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Price BoxPlot'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontdict</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'fontfamily'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'weight'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'bold'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'size'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">})</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Price (US dollars)'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xticks</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">20000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">40000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">60000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">80000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">100000</span><span class="p">],</span> \
           <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'0'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'20,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'40,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'60,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'80,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'100,000'</span><span class="p">],</span>\
           <span class="n">fontfamily</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.7</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">grid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">visible</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We now have outliers that can make sense. A price of <strong>100,000</strong> US dollars for a secondhand car is realistic.</p>
<p>Let us display some descriptive statistics for <code>price</code> column and see what we have about this column.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [29]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">describe</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[29]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>count    43326.000000
mean      6232.335826
std       7560.888729
min        500.000000
25%       1500.000000
50%       3500.000000
75%       7999.000000
max      99999.000000
Name: price, dtype: float64</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We now have a <code>price</code> column that is clean. The following are the basic statistics as displayed above:
    <code>minimum price</code> <strong>500</strong> dollars,
    <code>maximum price</code> <strong>99,999</strong> dollars,
    <code>medium price</code>  <strong>3, 500</strong> dollars, and 
    <code>mean price</code>    <strong>6,232</strong> dollars. 
The <strong>mean</strong> value is different from <strong>median</strong> value because it is affected by car prices of expencive cars. It seems many cars are priced in the range between <strong>1,500</strong> and <strong>7,999</strong> dollars, so prices of more than <strong>8,000</strong> dollars are offsetting the value of the mean. In this case a good measure of average price could be the <strong>Median</strong> as it is not affected by outliers.</p>
<p>Let us explore <code>odometer_km</code> for outliers now. We will still use a boxplot.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [30]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">boxplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'odometer_km'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">vert</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Odometer_Km BoxPlot'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">weight</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'bold'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Odometer Leading (Km)'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xticks</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">40000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">80000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">120000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">160000</span><span class="p">],</span> \
           <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'0'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'40,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'80,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'120,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'160,000'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.7</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">grid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">visible</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>It shows that our <code>odomete_km</code> column does not have problems in as far as outliers are concerned. We have some cars with very little <strong>mileage</strong> and this is realistic even thought they have been presented in our boxplot. Let us display descriptive statistics for this column to get a wider perspective.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [31]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'odometer_km'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">describe</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[31]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>count     43326.000000
mean     125148.294327
std       39634.516717
min        5000.000000
25%      100000.000000
50%      150000.000000
75%      150000.000000
max      150000.000000
Name: odometer_km, dtype: float64</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The minimum <strong>mileage</strong> is <strong>5,000</strong> kilometers and maximum <strong>mileage</strong> is <strong>150,000</strong> kilometers.</p>
<p>Now that we have a clean dataset, let us view the first five records and last five records of our dataset.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [32]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">auto</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[32]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
